isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Service (1991) - CONNECTING RODS, PISTONS AND RINGS - CONNECTING RODS, PISTONS AND RINGS (Reconditioning) - Repair

step1.para: Install a new connecting rod bushing using installer tool ZTSE4154 as follows:

step2.para:
Place the connecting rod on a flat surface plate with the "large" chamfer side of the main bearing bore up ( 1, Figure 5.32
).

note.para: The clinch joint (split) in the bushing must be located in the connecting rod as shown in Figure 5.33.

step2.para: Press the new bushing in place flush or below the surfaces of both sides of the rod.

step1.para:
After bushing has been installed in the rod, it must be honed to the proper I.D. (see "SPECIFICATIONS"). Use SE2218 honing machine, Figure 5.34
.

step1.para: If bearing-to-crankshaft running clearances exceed specifications, because of wear regrind the crankshaft and install undersize precision type bearing shells.

important.para: DO NOT ATTEMPT TO REDUCE JOURNAL- TO-BEARING RUNNING CLEARANCES BY REWORKING BEARING CAP, BEARING OR BOTH. GRIND THE CRANKSHAFT ONLY. REFER TO SECTION 6.

caution.para: REWORKING THE BEARING CAP AND/OR BEARINGS WILL DESTROY THE ENGINEERED FIT TO THE BEARING SHELLS IN THEIR BORES (BEARING CRUSH).

step1.para: Tighten the connecting rod bolts and nuts alternately and evenly to the specified torque, using an accurate torque wrench. (See TORQUE SPECIFICATIONS)

note.para: ABOUT BEARING CRUSH AND SPREAD! Bearing shells must fit tightly in the bore. When bearing shells are inserted into the connecting rod and cap, they protrude above the parting line. This protrusion is required to achieve "BEARlNG CRUSH". Bearing shells are designed with "SPREAD". That is, the width across the open ends are slightly larger than the diameter of the connecting rod bore into which they are assembled, as shown in Figure 5.35. This condition is designed into the bearing shell causing it to spread outward at the parting line when "CRUSH" load is applied by tightening the bolts. Some may be lost in normal use, but bearing replacement is not required because of a nominal loss of snap .ap.

para.emph: When the assembly is drawn up tight, the bearing is compressed, assuring a positive contact between the bearing back and the bore as shown in (2A & B, Figure 5.36).

step1.para: Fit connecting rod bearings and measure bearing running clearance as follows:

step2.para: With bearing cap removed, wipe oil from the face of the bearing insert and exposed portion of the crankshaft journal.
Place a piece of "Plastigage(r)" across the full width of the bearing about 1/4 in. off center.
Install the cap and tighten bolts and nuts evenly and alternately to specified torque.

note.para: Do not turn the crankshaft during running clearance check.

step2.para:
Remove bearing cap. The "Plastigage(r)" material will be found adhering to either the bearing shell or the crankshaft. DO NOT REMOVE "PLASTIGAGE(r) ". Use "Plastigage(r)" scale to measure widest point of flattened plastic material, Figure 5.37
. The number within the graduated marks on the scale indicates the clearance in thousandths of an inch and millimeters (see "SPECIFICATIONS").
Remove the test material and repeat test for each connecting rod bearing.

note.para: With the precision bearings used, no problem should be encountered. However, if proper clearance is NOT achieved, a problem with the crankshaft may exist which requires regrinding and the use of undersize bearings. (Refer to Section 6 for Crankshaft Rework Information.)
Additionally, bearing cap torque is very important. Use a torque wrench which is known to be accurate. Repeat running clearance check procedure before condemning the crankshaft.

step1.para:
Check connecting rod side clearance, using a feeler gauge as shown in Figure 5.38
. (See "SPECIFICATIONS")

note.para: The connecting rod end clearance must be checked to be certain that the specified clearance exists.
Lack of clearance could indicate a damaged rod or a rod bearing out of position. Correct as required.
Excessive clearance may require replacement of the rods or crankshaft. Correct as required.
